alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Northern Will; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Will, southeastern DuPage and southeastern Cook Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from Joliet to Chicago, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 420 PM, nickel size hail occurred at the NWS Chicago office in Romeoville. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chicago, Joliet, Cicero, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Romeoville, Plainfield, Calumet City, Woodridge, Chicago Lawn, Englewood, South Shore, Roseland, Bridgeport, Chicago Loop, South Lawndale, Midway Airport and Burbank. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 252 and 294. I-57 between mile markers 347 and 358. I-80 between mile markers 129 and 146. I-90 between mile markers 101 and 107. I-94 between mile markers 52 and 70. I-294 between mile markers 52 and 70. I-355 between mile markers 1 and 13. This includes... Argonne National Laboratory, Toyota Park, University of Chicago, University of St. Francis, Windy City Thunderbolts Baseball, Joliet Junior College, Joliet Slammers Baseball, Lewis University, Moraine Valley Community College, Soldier Field, University of Illinois Chicago, US Cellular Field...IL Institute of Technology, Museum of Science and Industry, Museum Campus, and Northerly Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Northern Will; Southern Cook
